sections.name: intro
sections.description: F5 Application Services Integration iApp v%IMPLVERSION_MAJOR%(%IMPLVERSION_MINOR%)_%PRESENTATION_REV% (Community Edition)

fields.name: strictUpdates
fields.help: Control `Strict Updates <https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/products/big-ip_ltm/manuals/product/bigip-iapps-developer-11-4-0/2.html#unique_1198712211>`_ mode

fields.name: appStats
fields.help: Control whether Virtual Server/Pool statistics handlers are created in Standalone or iWorkflow mode

fields.name: mode
fields.help: The mode to use during deployment.  The default setting of auto determines the mode automatically.

fields.name: logLevel
fields.help: The log level to use during deployment.  0=silent, 10=most verbose

fields.name: routeDomain
fields.help: The route domain to use during deployment.  Setting to 'auto' determines the Route Domain automatically using the partition default-route-domain.  In APIC mode we determine the RD from the config since it doesn't set default-route-domain

fields.name: asmDeployMode
fields.help: The behaviour to take on iApp (re)deployment for ASM policies.  The 'redeploy' options will replace the existing policy with the one packaged in the template.  The 'preserve' options keep the existing policy.  The 'block' modifier to both preserve and redeploy marks the deployed virtual server down to prevent traffic from reaching pool members until policy deployment is complete.  The 'bypass' modifier does not change the virtual server state, however, could cause traffic to bypass the policy until deployment completes.

fields.name: apmDeployMode
fields.help: The behaviour to take on iApp (re)deployment for an APM policy.  The 'redeploy' options will replace the existing policy with the one packaged in the template.  The 'preserve' options keep the existing policy.  The 'block' modifier to both preserve and redeploy marks the deployed virtual server down to prevent traffic from reaching pool members until policy deployment is complete.  The 'bypass' modifier does not change the virtual server state, however, could cause traffic to bypass the policy until deployment completes.

fields.name: addr
fields.help: The destination address of the Virtual Server.  Specifying a value of '255.255.255.254' will skip Virtual Server creation.

fields.name: mask
fields.help: The destination network mask of the Virtual Server

fields.name: port
fields.help: The L4 port the Virtual Server listens on.  '*' is supported

fields.name: DefaultPoolIndex
fields.help: The index of the pool to use as the default pool for the Virtual Server

fields.name: Pools
fields.help: The pools to create.  Note that pool index must be >0 and sequential.

fields.name: Index
fields.help: The Pool Index of this Pool

fields.name: Name
fields.help: The Name of this Pool

fields.name: Description
fields.help: The Description of this Pool

fields.name: LbMethod
fields.help: The pool `Load Balancing Method <https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/products/big-ip_ltm/manuals/product/ltm_configuration_guide_10_0_0/ltm_pools.html#1215305>`_

fields.name: Monitor
fields.help: The pool monitor(s) and minimum number of monitors that have to pass can be specified using a string of the format '[<monitor index>[,<monitor index>][;<minimum # healthy>]]'.  For example '0,1,2;2' would associate the monitors with indexes 0, 1 and 2 and require at least 2 pass.  If no value is specified no monitor is associated with the pool

fields.name: AdvOptions
fields.help: The options to set in the created Pool.  Options can be specified using the format: <tmsh_option_name>=<tmsh_option_value>[,<tmsh_option_name>=<tmsh_option_value>]

fields.name: MemberDefaultPort
fields.help: The L4 port to used when a pool member is added via a Dynamic Endpoint Insertion notication from Cisco APIC

fields.name: Members
fields.help: The configuration for Pool Members within the Pool.

fields.name: Index
fields.help: The Index cross-reference of the Pool in the Pools table this Member is a part of

fields.name: IPAddress
fields.help: IP Address OR Node Name of the Pool Member

fields.name: Port
fields.help: L4 port of the Pool Member

fields.name: ConnectionLimit
fields.help: The Connection Limit for the Pool Member.  '0' denotes unlimited connections

fields.name: Ratio
fields.help: The Ratio weight for the Pool Member.  Used with 'ratio' based Load Balancing Methods

fields.name: PriorityGroup
fields.help: The Priority Group for the Pool Member.

fields.name: State
fields.help: The administrative state of the Pool Member upon creation

fields.name: AdvOptions
fields.help: The Advanced Options for the Pool Member.

fields.name: Monitors
fields.help: The monitors to create/associate.  Note that monitor index must be >0 and sequential.

fields.name: Index
fields.help: The Index of this Monitor

fields.name: Name
fields.help: The Name of the Monitor to create or associate.  To associate an existing monitor specify the full path to the existing monitor object (e.g. '/Common/http')

fields.name: Type
fields.help: The Type of this Monitor.  To determine the available types on a BIG-IP system execute 'tmsh create ltm monitor ?' from the CLI

fields.name: Options
fields.help: The options to set in the created Monitor.  Options can be specified using the format: <tmsh_option_name>=<tmsh_option_value>[,<tmsh_option_name>=<tmsh_option_value>]

fields.name: Listeners
fields.help: A list of additional IPv4/IPv6 listeners to create.  All listeners will be configured identically except if flags are specified in the Destination column modifying specific profiles.

fields.name: Listener
fields.help: Listener to create in <address>:<port> format

fields.name: Destination
fields.help: The destination for traffic bound for this listener in the format (default|<pool index>|redirect|<TMOS pool object path>)[;(nossl|noclientssl|noserverssl)].  If no value or the keyword 'default' is specified the default pool index will be used.

fields.name: Name
fields.help: The name of the Virtual Server.  If no value is specified the name will be set to <iapp_name>_vs

fields.name: Description
fields.help: The description string configured in the Virtual Server

fields.name: RouteAdv
fields.help: Control the route-advertisement behaviour setting of the associated Virtual Address object.  Routing protocol configuration must be completed on the device manually.

fields.name: SourceAddress
fields.help: The source address filter for the Virtual Server

fields.name: IpProtocol
fields.help: The IP Protocol of the Virtual Server (e.g. tcp, udp)

fields.name: ConnectionLimit
fields.description: Virtual Server: Virtual Server Connection Limit (0=unlimited)
fields.help: The connection limit for the virtual server.  A value of '0' means no limit

fields.name: ProfileClientProtocol
fields.description: Virtual Server: Client-side L4 Protocol Profile
fields.help: The client-side protocol profile.  This field supports the 'create:' format for customization

fields.name: ProfileServerProtocol
fields.description: Virtual Server: Server-side L4 Protocol Profile
fields.help: The server-side protocol profile.  This field supports the 'create:' format for customization

fields.name: ProfileHTTP
fields.help: The HTTP protocol profile.  This field supports the 'create:' format for customization

fields.name: ProfileOneConnect
fields.help: The oneconnect profile.  This field supports the 'create:' format for customization

fields.name: ProfileCompression
fields.help: The compression profile.  This field supports the 'create:' format for customization

fields.name: ProfileAnalytics
fields.help: The analytics profile

fields.name: ProfileRequestLogging
fields.help: The request logging profile.  This field supports the 'create:' format for customization

fields.name: ProfileDefaultPersist
fields.help: The default persistence profile.  This field supports the 'create:' format for customization.  A key of 'type' specifying the persisence type to create must be specified (ex: create:type=cookie;...)

fields.name: ProfileFallbackPersist
fields.help: The fallback persistence profile.  This field supports the 'create:' format for customization.  A key of 'type' specifying the persisence type to create must be specified (ex: create:type=cookie;...)

fields.name: SNATConfig
fields.description: Virtual Server: SNAT Configuration (enter SNAT pool name, 'automap' or leave blank to disable SNAT)
fields.help: The SNAT option to use.  Specifiy 'automap','/Common/<existing_snat_pool_name>','partition-default','create:<ip1,>....<ipX>'.  The partition-default option references a SNAT pool created by Cisco APIC as part of the APIC partition

fields.name: ProfileServerSSL
fields.help: The server-ssl profile.  This field supports the 'create:' format for customization

fields.name: ProfileClientSSL
fields.help: The path to an existing Client-SSL profile.  If specified this value overrides Client-SSL profile creation

fields.name: ProfileClientSSLCert
fields.help: The path to an existing SSL Certificate.  If the word 'auto' is specfied the value /Common/<iapp_name>.crt will be substituted.  This field also supports the url=<url> format to load a PEM encoded resources.

fields.name: ProfileClientSSLKey
fields.help: The path to an existing SSL Key.  If the word 'auto' is specfied the value /Common/<iapp_name>.key will be substituted.  This field also supports the url=<url> format to load a PEM encoded resources.

fields.name: ProfileClientSSLChain
fields.description: Virtual Server: Client SSL Certificate Chain
fields.help: The path to the SSL Certicate Chain bundle.  This field also supports the url=<url> format to load a PEM encoded resources.

fields.name: ProfileClientSSLCipherString
fields.description: Virtual Server: Client SSL Cipher String
fields.help: The SSL `Cipher String <https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/13000/100/sol13171.html>`_

fields.name: ProfileClientSSLAdvOptions
fields.description: Virtual Server: Client SSL Advanced Options
fields.help: The options to set in the created Client-SSL profile.  Options can be specified using the format: <tmsh_option_name>=<tmsh_option_value>[,<tmsh_option_name>=<tmsh_option_value>]

fields.name: ProfileSecurityLogProfiles
fields.help: A comma seperated list of existing security logging profiles

fields.name: ProfileSecurityIPBlacklist
fields.help: Configuration for the IP Intelligence Dynamic IP Blacklist.  An existing subscription is required for this feature.  A pre-exsiting policy may be specified by entering it's full path (ex: /Common/my_ipi_policy)

fields.name: ProfileSecurityDoS
fields.help: The DoS Protection Policy to configure

fields.name: ProfileAccess
fields.help: The APM Access Policy to configure.  To automatically associate a bundled APM policy after deployment use the value 'use-bundled'

fields.name: ProfileConnectivity
fields.help: The APM Connectivity Policy to configure

fields.name: ProfilePerRequest
fields.help: The APM Per-Request Policy to configure

fields.name: OptionSourcePort
fields.help: The source port translation behavior

fields.name: OptionConnectionMirroring
fields.help: The connection mirroring behavior

fields.name: Irules
fields.description: Virtual Server: iRules (to specify multiple iRules seperate with a comma ex: irule1,irule2,irule3)
fields.help: A comma seperated list of existing iRules to attach to the virtual server.  Ordering is preserved.

fields.name: BundledItems
fields.help: The bundled resources to deploy.  See bundled/README for more info.

fields.name: Resource
fields.help: The bundled items to deploy.  See bundled/README for more info.

fields.name: AdvOptions
fields.help: The options to set in the created Virtual Server.  Options can be specified using the format: <tmsh_option_name>=<tmsh_option_value>[,<tmsh_option_name>=<tmsh_option_value>]

fields.name: AdvProfiles
fields.help: A comma-seperated list of profiles to link to the Virtual Server: <profile_name>[,<profile_name>]

fields.name: AdvPolicies
fields.help: A comma-seperated list of policies to link to the Virtual Server: <policy_name>[,<policy_name>]

fields.name: VirtualAddrAdvOptions
fields.help: The options to set in the global Virtual Address object.  Options can be specified using the format: <tmsh_option_name>=<tmsh_option_value>[,<tmsh_option_name>=<tmsh_option_value>]

fields.name: strategy
fields.help: The Matching Strategy to use for the `L7 Policy <https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/products/big-ip_ltm/manuals/product/ltm-concepts-11-5-1/3.html>`_

fields.name: defaultASM
fields.help: The default ASM policy to use for the L7 Policy.  Specifying a value of 'bypass' will set all actions to bypass ASM processing unless a explicit ASM Action Target is specified

fields.name: defaultL7DOS
fields.description: L7 Policy: Default L7 DoS Policy
fields.help: The default L7 DoS policy to use for the L7 Policy.  Specifying a value of 'bypass' will set all actions to bypass ASM processing unless a explicit L7 DoS Action Target is specified

fields.name: rulesMatch
fields.help: The L7 policy `Matching <https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/products/big-ip_ltm/manuals/product/ltm-concepts-11-5-1/3.html>`_ ruleset to configure.

fields.name: Group
fields.help: The group for this match rule.  The corresponding action is configured by specifying a matching action with the same group(s).  Multiple rows with the same group may be specified to create multiple match conditions.

fields.name: Operand
fields.help: The specific operand to use for a policy match.

fields.name: Negate
fields.help: Reverses the meaning of the operation (for example, enabling Negate and specifying https as the starts-with value resolves to true if the header does not start with https).

fields.name: Condition
fields.help: Specifies a conditions to use for matching.

fields.name: Value
fields.help: Specifies a list of values the operand is matched against.  To specify multiple values seperate with a ';'

fields.name: CaseSensitive
fields.help: Specifies a list of values the operand is matched against.  To specify multiple values seperate with a ';'

fields.name: Missing
fields.help: Indicates whether a value can be missing.

fields.name: rulesAction
fields.help: The L7 policy `Action <https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/products/big-ip_ltm/manuals/product/ltm-concepts-11-5-1/3.html>`_ ruleset actions to configure

fields.name: Group
fields.help: The group for this action rule.  Multiple rows with the same group may be specified to create multiple action targets

fields.name: Target
fields.help: The specific target to use for a policy match.

fields.name: Parameter
fields.help: Specifies the value for the action. Possible values depend on the target.  Multiple values can be entered by seperating with a ';'.  To reference a bundled policy item for use with a supported target use the format 'bundled:<bundled item name>'

fields.name: statsTLS
fields.help: TLS/SSL Statistics reporting.  The auto option will enable this feature if a client-ssl profile is attached, otherwise disable

fields.name: statsHTTP
fields.help: HTTP Statistics reporting.  The auto option will enable this feature if a http profile is attached, otherwise disable

fields.name: insertXForwardedFor
fields.help: Insert the X-Forwarded-For header.  The auto option will enable this feature if a HTTP profile and SNAT is configured, otherwise disable

fields.name: redirectToHTTPS
fields.help: Create a virtual service on TCP/80 that performs a 302 HTTP redirect to TCP/443 on the same IP address.  The auto option will enable this feature if a HTTP profile is configured and the TCP port is 443, otherwise disable

fields.name: sslEasyCipher
fields.description: TLS/SSL: Easy Cipher String (overrides VS section setting)
fields.help: Easily configure TLS/SSL Cipher Strings.  This setting overrides the value in the Virtual Server section

fields.name: securityEnableHSTS
fields.description: HTTP: Security: Enable HTTP Strict Transport Security (only valid if ClientSSL is configured)
fields.help: Enabled insertion of the Strict-Transport-Security HTTP header.  The preload and subdomain options can be omitted or included based on this selection.  This setting also modifies creation of the HTTP->HTTPS redirect option to perform a 301 HTTP redirect.  The max-age parameter can be specified by appending ';max-age=<value>'

fields.name: easyL4Firewall
fields.description: Security: Firewall: Configure L4 Firewall Policy
fields.help: Configure a AFM L4 Firewall policy.  The 'base' option creates a policy that allows traffic to the Virtual Server with optional Blacklist and Source addresses specified in the following fields.  The base+ip_blacklist options also configure an IP Intelligence Blacklist policy in either blocking or logging mode.  The auto mode is equivalent to the base+ip_blacklist_block option with the exception that if a user-specfic IPI policy is specified it will be preserved

fields.name: easyL4FirewallBlacklist
fields.description: Security: Firewall: Static Blacklisted Addresses (CIDR Format)
fields.help: A list of CIDR formatted blacklisted IP/Network ranges.  Packets sourced from these networks will be dropped

fields.name: CIDRRange
fields.help: CIDR Range

fields.name: easyL4FirewallSourceList
fields.description: Security: Firewall: Static Allowed Source Addresses (CIDR Format)
fields.help: A list of CIDR formatted allowed IP/Network ranges.  Packets sourced from these networks will be allowed

fields.name: CIDRRange
fields.help: CIDR Range
